decision_conditions: <p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The development hereby granted must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the date this prior approval is granted.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-4dd66ae0-7fff-9f6f-64b0-313034b5c280"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: In accordance with Condition 3c of Class AA of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) .</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Prior to commencement, the developer must submit to the local planning authority for approval in writing a report for the management of the construction of the development, which sets out the proposed development hours of operation and how any adverse impact of noise, dust, vibration and traffic on adjoining owners or occupiers will be mitigated.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-91f9cde8-7fff-227d-6c06-91aac358d037"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To ensure effects are adequately managed to protect neighbouring amenity in accordance with condition 3(b) of Class AA of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The development shall be undertaken in full accordance with the conditions set out in the relevant part of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-f4fd1af1-7fff-c664-5e78-96040abcc0f3"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To comply with the requirements of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">All new works, and works of making good to the retained fabric, whether internal or external, shall be finished to match the original work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions, composition, form, colour, finish and profile, and in the case of brickwork, facebond and pointing.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-662857ce-7fff-56ab-187b-ac40328652f6"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">REASON: To ensure a suitable external appearance in accordance with condition A.A.2(3)(ii) of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The developer must notify the local planning authority of the completion of the development as soon as reasonably practicable after completion; and that notification must be in writing and includeâ€”(i) the name of the developer;(ii) the address of the dwellinghouse; and(iii) the date of completion.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-1cf51f64-7fff-c40b-5e5c-fdf09d9aa1ee"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: In accordance with conditions 3(d) and 3(e) Class AA of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).</span></p>
description: Prior Approval (Class AA) for an additional storey of 2.8 metres in height to the main (original) footprint of the dwelling and associated alterations.
